intro: Phyllanthus nitens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a small shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features opposite, narrow leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Phyllanthus nitens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
